topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade (Beta): Creating, Editing, and Deleting Volumes

body.p: Volumes are block devices that can be attached to instances.

li.p: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Click the Project dashboard, then the System panel, then the Volumes link.
In the Create Volume dialog box, enter the relevant information for the volume:

ul.li: Volume Name - Enter a name for the volume

Volume Source - Select one of the following options:
No source, empty volume - creates an empty volume and does not contain a file system or a partition table
Image - a new field for Use image as a source displays. You can select the image from the list.
Size - Enter the size of the volume in gigabytes
Availability Zone - Select the availability zone. By default, this value is set to 'any availability zone'.

li.p: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Click the Project dashboard, then the System panel, then the Volumes link.
Under the Actions column, click Edit Volume, next to the volume you want to edit. .
In the Edit Volume dialog box, modify the name and description.
Note: You can extend a volume by using the Extend Volume option available in the More drop-down list and entering the new value for volume size.
Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Click the Project dashboard, then the System panel, then the Volumes link.
Select the volume(s) that you want to delete.
